meanings.definition: To give a wrong or unnatural color to something.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally miscoloured her painting by mixing the wrong colors.
meanings.sent2: The artist didn't mean to miscolour the sky purple instead of blue.
meanings.sent3: The miscoloured cupcakes looked like they belonged in a fantasy world.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to miscolour reality only made the scene more surreal.
meanings.sent5: The sunsets in her paintings were always miscoloured in vibrant shades.

meanings.sent1: The old photographs started to miscolour over time, turning yellow.
meanings.sent2: The white shirt miscoloured after being washed with a red sock.
meanings.sent3: The miscoloured leaves on the tree made it look like it was wearing a colorful coat.
meanings.sent4: The memories began to miscolour with nostalgia, becoming more vivid in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The once pristine walls of the house slowly miscoloured with age and neglect.
